thread.title: UnReal Estate: Seventh heaven in unique Shenton Park cottage
thread.title_full: UnReal Estate: Seventh heaven in unique Shenton Park cottage

title: UnReal Estate: Seventh heaven in unique Shenton Park cottage
text:
THERE’S more than one reason visitors might picture a choir warming up when they step through doors of this Shenton Park home.
With an entry through a brick archway surrounded by lush gardens, the home used to form part of the original St Aloysius Church buildings.
Believed to be nearly 100 years old, this unique cottage was converted into a home in 1996, but has retained many of its original features.
14 William St, Shenton Park. Source: Supplied
Featuring cathedral ceilings, a mezzanine bedroom and a huge open-plan bathroom with a deep tub, the home is characterised by a romantic feel.
Outdoors the garden, which has been adorned with statues reminiscent of the home’s religious roots, is the perfect sanctuary.
Including a fish pond and mature trees, the home is secluded and set back from the street by the vine-covered walls while the second outdoor space features a private timber deck.
Selling agent Michael Hoad said the home’s historic background was attracting a range of buyers.
“It’s a very unique home in more than one way, and a lot of families have been walking through and falling in love with the home’s history,” he said.
14 William Street Shenton Park Source: Supplied
14 WILLIAM ST, SHENTON PARK
Price : From $840,000
Land : 192sqm
Contact : Michael Hoad 0411 885 556, Paxton Hoad Subiaco
Features : Church history, cathedral ceilings and mezzanine bedroom.
Originally published as Seventh heaven in century-old cottage
